Reviews.Title: Great Camera At An Affordable Price
Reviews.Author: K. Abbas
Reviews.Content: Camera is compact and light weight. It has all the basic features you would need for great pictures and it is fairly easy to use. I was able to play with it for less than 5 minutes and have all the controls figured out without looking at a manual. The battery life seems great as I just got back from a week long vacation and after snapping over 150 photos I still have almost a full battery. I am also very impressed with how great my pictures turned out, vivid colors and great contrast.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the price
Reviews.Author: D. Thierry
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product as I planned a last-minute visit to the Niagara Falls and, being on a business trip, I had nothing else to immortalize this moment than my smartphone and its lousy camera. After unpacking it, I first tried it indoors and was not impressed at all: mediocre yellowish pictures, noisy and grainy. I tried to disable the (weak) flash and it got worse. I was tempted to return it immediately but decided to give it a try outdoors. When I started to shoot the falls, I became very quickly addicted to this litte gizmo. In most of the cases, the camera is able to deal with the subject, although I would recommend the usage of the advanced scene mode: facing violent contrasts, the camera shoots automatically twice with different exposure parameters, which increases the odds to get a good shot. Smart.The exposure can be easily fixed manually, using the "manual" mode (in fact, an automatic mode that can be adjusted). In a matter of seconds, over-exposed white water on dark rocks takes texture, to the droplet. It is a bit of trial and error, but delivers quick results. The panorama function works very well, delivery much better pictures than the lousy prints available in the souvenir shop. I also gave it a chance to show how it works with video: better than average sound (if not too much wind), functional and silent zoom and again, surprising image quality. As the light changed due to overcast clouds, I adjusted the settings and the camera obediently followed, again delivering satisfying stills. The zoom works fine. It's not a super-zoom but the resolution is good enough to enable enlargement on the PC.Happy with the outdoor quality, I decided to give it another try indoors, using the advanced mode P. To my surprise, the various settings, including several white balance modes, enabled to fix the initial issues and I got noise-free, decent-quality pictures under artificial lighting. I fumbled a bit with the flash and while I find it a bit rough, it's within expectations.Outdoor picture quality is really great for the price - I was really positively surprised by the sharpness and color quality, which is still far from SLR standards but surprising for a compact. The autofocus is decent, shutter speed good, transfer speed correct. The camera behaves predictably. It is more limited indoors but still very decent once one gets used to it. I was not disturbed by the lack of functionality to adjust speed or aperture as I'm using it for point-and-shoot, which it does pretty well in general. It's not a function-rich camera, but what's built in is useful and working well (the online manual may need some polishing though).I'm giving it five stars because this Sony camera exceeds consistently my value-for-money expectations. It cannot be a substitute for more serious hardware (I own a Sony Alpha and my wife is a NEX user) but it is definitively the camera I will take on business trips or in my breast pocket for a casual walk in the park.

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: D. Nissenbaum "DN"
Reviews.Content: So the image quality isn't perfect- but it's pretty darn close (the only reason this camera got 4 stars instead of 5). I like taking pictures with it. The menu features are really easy to figure out, so it's no trouble changing the settings to my liking. My favorite part of the camera? the Panorama view- I think Sony was genius with that addition! Definitely worth the money- and Sony has a pretty good name in cameras so you know it's a good investment. Total bonus- I love that my camera is red- not just boring black or silver.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: JRM
Reviews.Content: This purchase was great. Sony always delivers amazing quality. The camera has some great features and is state of the art. The bundle is a nice deal price-wise; The memory card has more than enough capacity and the case is OK (It's not as nice as others, but it's good for keeping the camera safe). I recomend this product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Naidyna
Reviews.Content: This a wonderful camera. Camera is compact and light weight. 16 megapixels. You will get a GREAT camera for a little over $100.Very easy to use, takes amazing pictures for the price and size. I would highly recommend anyone buying this camera. it takes video, and panoramic pictures. fast shipping.

Reviews.Title: great pix, easy to change modes
Reviews.Author: iris571
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best cameras I have owned.  It takes wonderful pictures and videos.  Changing modes is as easy as sliding the button up or down.  I loved it so much that when my adult son asked for a camera for his birthday I didn't even have to shop, there was no doubt which one he was getting.  So we each have one and can not sing it's praises loud enough!

Reviews.Title: Nifty Camera
Reviews.Author: Crafty Lady
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera in it's price class. I was surprised by it's size ( as small as a cell phone ) but with that said, it packs alot of punch. Takes great pictures and is easy to operate. The only drawback is low light pictures aren't as sharp as could be. All in all you get alot for the money with this Sony,

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera for taking pics of your kids or in low lighting
Reviews.Author: L. Gottlieb
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift and it is the worst camera I've had in years. Almost all photos indoors take forever to shoot and its a long lag between taking shots. As a result, you will never get the picture of your child you were aiming for. I've missed more great shots with this camera than I can count. I've gone back to using my iPhone because its honestly a better camera for getting the right picture of my kids.If you will be taking pictures of statues in perfect sunlight, it's fine, but anything moving and without direct sunlight, this camera is pretty much a paperweight.

Reviews.Title: Great camera !
Reviews.Author: oldconsumer 47
Reviews.Content: This is my second Sony in this series. Both have taken 1000s of photos. The first one I dropped (my fault) and broke the viewing screen. I like d the Sony so I got a newer updated version with equally great results. The only little thing is the on/off switch should have a little more of a bump on it so you can feel it and not have to hunt for it the press it.I give it a 99.99999999% rating. Buy one !

Reviews.Title: Pocket perfect
Reviews.Author: Mecca
Reviews.Content: Great deal in a small package flash on still shots is a bit over the top but for the price it's a great cam...

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal for the Price
Reviews.Author: Adam Dubberly
Reviews.Content: Recently bought this camera for a Thanksgiving trip to Disney.  It worked great as just a tourist camera (taking pics of the family in front of rides, etc) but also got some great shots of the castles, fireworks, and light parades.  Also, the 16 megapixels makes beautiful pictures when printed.  For the cost this is an absolutely great buy.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Gabriel R. Castillo "Gabe"
Reviews.Content: Purchased it for my wife's birthday - perfect little camera that she can take anywhere and fits into a small bag. Having the 16.1 captures and prints pictures nicely and we like the other point and shoot features.  Great camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Deal
Reviews.Author: ANJAN CHAKRABARTI
Reviews.Content: I bought this recently as a gift for a family member from Amazon. The is great point and shoot camera. It also came with a 8GB card & the camera case. It is a very good deal. The shipping as fast.

Reviews.Title: limited capability and poor results
Reviews.Author: Frederick E. Hutchings
Reviews.Content: Even at this price, this camera is very disappointing. It is literally too automatic and makes terrible picture decisions.  There is no substantial means for user intervention to create better quality photos. When shooting indoors w/o flash, the ISO jumps to 800 and the pix are terrible. The camera lives at f:2.6, so any depth of field is next to impossible to achieve.And, why would anyone be interested in shooting video with a still camera that cannot deliver a quality still photograph is beyond me.  Video cameras shoot video, still cameras shoot still images. Who needs it?? And panorama?? Let's worry about decent stills first.This little camera has a Zeiss designed lens... You wouldn't know it looking at the pictures...  Infinity focus is just not there... At 16mp, 13x19" prints are noisy and mushy at all ISO settings. At 10mp and ISO 80-100, results are a little better - tolerable maybe. 8/5x11" - letter size prints were fair at best at all ISO settings... JPEG picture quality is very soft and grainy looking at all resolution settings.... 5X7" seems the largest acceptable prints size.I am a Leica owner (film) 2 bodies and half-dozen lenses.  I realize that a "simple"camera wont't deliver Leica quality, but when my wife complains about fuzzy images, there may be a problem.  She is not as discriminating about photo quality as I am; it's not what she does.When she questioned the results with this camera, I took it and compared it print for print with my Sony Alpha 100 (10mp DSLR) using to prime and a Tamron wide-angle zoom lenses to match various focal lengths.  I know the alpha sensor is bigger, but 16mp against 10mp ought to be somewhat close in quality.  It wasn't.  At almost double the resolution it clearly did not come close.Think she might like to try a Canon Powershot S100, G12, or G1X. All of these are more expensive, but the quality is the issue here. She is now using a Sony DSC-F828.  The only problem is physical size. It is only an 8mp camera and has a Zeiss zoom lens that opens to f:2.0 - f2.8 across its entire zoom range.  It is 9 years old and I have produced 13x19" gallery prints with it with no need for photo-shop enhancement.  If Sony still made this camera with a 10 or 12mp sensor, It would still be my camera of choice.Since this is an edited re-posting, I have to add that Amazon refunded my purchase in less that 5 business days... No problem.  Have also purchased an Alpha 290 from Amazon.. If it proves a problem, the Canons are next or perhaps the Panasonic Lumix LX5.FRED HUTCHINGS

Reviews.Title: Love this line of cameras
Reviews.Author: Consumer816
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use, takes amazing pictures for the price and size. I would highly recommend anyone buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good product for a great price
Reviews.Author: amazonbuyer
Reviews.Content: I bought this product in May 2012. I works great. The LCD is huge. The picture quality is very good. Can take very good quality movies and picsWhat makes me annoying is that i cannot see the last picture i have taken. I bought 5X zoom, i wish i had gotten 10X zoom instead. Would have helped in taking long shots. Easy to carry and it is light weight. Will fit in your pocket perfectly. battery life is very good. Just came back from a 4 day vacation and the battery never died. Only advise i have is that when you buy your memeory card, make sure it is atleast 10GB. I bought 4GB card from amazon and returned it for 10GB. You need the capability of taking atleast 500 pics before your memory card fills up. It will be a perfect gift for your anyone in your family

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Brian Long
Reviews.Content: This camera takes nice crisp pictures.  I wasn't looking for anything along the lines of a professional camera, but I am pleasantly surprised by the quality.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Riedle
Reviews.Content: Great camera for very little money. Very good in low light. Very small and well built. Panorama feature very cool!

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality and color
Reviews.Author: TTC
Reviews.Content: I wanted to really like this camera.  It has a lot of features that seem pretty fancy.  Unfortunately the camera does a very poor job.  I used it for a week around and including Christmas taking about 50 or so indoor shots at all resolution modes.Image QualityBy far, most of the images were blurry.  When there was even the slightest movement, the object would be smeared across the photo.  When there were two subjects in the photo, the camera would focus on one and not the other, even if the depth was around 1 foot different.Color QualityEvery photo was washed out.  As noted in other reviews, the weak flash did not help here either.Needless to say, it will be going back.

Reviews.Title: Camera very nice in red
Reviews.Author: Terry Jokinen
Reviews.Content: Bought this with the red carrying case for 78 year old mother in law. She was so thrilled. Works great for point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Gift Camera
Reviews.Author: Donald L. Held Jr. "Glass Man"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my granddaughter to use on and off campus. It does many things a teen wants, the pictures are Outstanding, close up and far away. Cost is a very good deal for a gift.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Rpierre185
Reviews.Content: I wanted an inexpensive camera to snap pictures and take random vids and this camera meets that need perfectly. I am still navigating the features and havent yet mastered all the functions, but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Blanco's camera
Reviews.Author: Jane Ogletree
Reviews.Content: We purchased this unpon recommendation of another physician in the clinic for use with tracking treatments progression.  Has been giving us very clear and easy pictures.  A little differenct application from family photos but very effective.

Reviews.Title: Its a point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Deepan
Reviews.Content: This is a simple to use point and shoot camera which i bought on thanksgiving of 2013. The deal seemed good and i wanted a decent camera before my graduation. It did the job as expected. Typical SONY device. It has been doing good so far and i have left it unattended for months and it still springs up and does not drain out battery power.The finish of the camera on the outside is good and holding it feels really nice.This might not be the best if you want to use in winter since the buttons on the top could be difficult to use with the gloves on.The picture quality is decent if you know how to configure and use for different lighting settings.Overall a very good product at less than $100

Reviews.Title: best for the value
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: cool camera great for vaction or out with friends the sd card and the usb cable make it easy to share

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: Jeni Gray-Roberts
Reviews.Content: This was a great bundle.  Everything works fine.  Camera is small enough to fit in pocket when hubby is not using the case.  Picture quality is exactly as expected for an affordable small camera.

Reviews.Title: Yes
Reviews.Author: Nunufar
Reviews.Content: Bought it while it was cheaper during black Friday. My sister's been using it ever since. Takes good pictures, has easy options, nice videos. Love it. I've always bought these.

Reviews.Title: A serious little picture machine taking great pics with sweet Carl Zeiss optics and great video too
Reviews.Author: Thomas "NikonD7000DSLRorg"
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these cameras, one for my fiancee and one for myself.  We both wanted something that we can always take with us.  This camera fits in a men's dress shirt pocket and is completely concealed.  We have used these cameras for the past six months and they have produced amazing pictures.  We are both extremely happy with these little photographic wonders.I own three cameras ... this one...an Olympus XZ-1 ... and a Nikon D7000 DSLR, and I use all three ...mostly the DSLR whenever I can.This camera gets 5 stars for the following reasons and considering  that it is a pocket camera (not a DSLR ;-) - digital single lens reflex camera):1)  The size of the camera is only 3.8 inches x 2.2 inches with a 3" back review LCD screen (230k dots resolution, awesome for this little wonder) and less than an inch thin (0.8") with control elements that even a grown man can reasonably operate.  So very compact but well designed elements.2)  The camera has 16.1 MP and has outstanding Carl Zeiss optics (5x optical zoom).Carl Zeiss optics are flawless in quality, and without the optics nothing else matters.  That this camera has such a high quality lens is a great sign of what's behind the lens.  The lens is image stabilized.Lens Type : Carl Zeiss® Vario-Tessar®Optical Zoom : 5xFocal Length (35mm equivalent) : Still 16:9: 28-140mm / Still 4:3: 25-125mm / Movie 16:9: 29-145mm(SteadyShot Standard), 30-150mm(SteadyShot Active) / Movie 4:3: 35-175mm(SteadyShot Standard), f=37-185mm(SteadyShot Active)Lens Construction : 6 elements in 5 groups (including 3 aspheric elements)Minimum Focus Distance : iAuto:AF(W:Approx..5cm(0.16') to Infinity, T:Approx.100cm(3.28') to Infinity) / Program Auto:AF(W:Approx..5cm(0.16') to Infinity, T:Approx.100cm(3.28') to Infinity)Aspheric Elements : 3Steady Shot Mode:Active : YesRegarding the 16.1 MP image sensor.  I shoot this sony with 10MP resolution because I don't like to deal with huge files and it makes little difference to my perceived quality of this image from this camera.  However the results from this camera are truly outstanding.  You can produce a good looking 20" X 30" poster from this 10MP image, so with 16.1 MP full resolution you will get all you ever need for casual photography ( for what this camera is really meant for).  The resolution is adjustable with the easy to use menu screen:  16.1 MP, 10MP, 5MP (straight uploadable resolution to Facebook), VGA resolution (640x480 pixels for direct computer screen for a blog for example) all in 4:3 aspect ratio.  You can also choose wide screen shooting modes (aspect ratio 16:9) in these resolutions:  12 MP and 2 MP.So really plenty of options to adjust to your needs/preferences.3)  The camera can be operated in different camera modes including P (for most manual control):Intelligent Auto (works great), Program Auto (most control for the user), Picture Effect (for the instant artist ;-), 4 modes ), and scene mode (11 scene modes wow).a)  Intelligent Auto:  This is my main mode to use this camera for plain fun snap shots without having to think.  This camera is great in focusing, choosing modes and getting the best picture for you most of the time and instantly.  In iAuto you get to further select EASY mode (simplified menu and larger font for the true point and shooter who just rather not deal with anything except take a great picture), image resolution, single shooting or continous shooting (1 fps up to 100 shots), EV (exposure correction -2.0 to +2.0) basically to adjust image brightness, iScene auto and advanced,smile detection sensitivity (three settings),Face detection (off,auto,child priority,adult priority,in camera guide,operation settings menu (time,date,sounds).b) Program Auto: this gives you more choices for those more familiar with photography.  It is actually quite amazing to me how many cool features have been carried from advanced photography into this one-click-wonder.  same controls as in a) above but in addition these... ISO settings: Auto, 80,100,200,400,800,1600,3200;  White Balance: Auto,Daylight,Cloudy,Fluorescent 1,2,3, Incandescent,Flash,One Push and One Push Set (for custom white balance, cool!); Auto Focus: Multi AF,Center AF,Spot AF; Metering Mode: Multi,Center,Spot; DRO (recovering of tones in image): Off,standard,plus;c) Picture effect:  I haven't used these...you can do it with photoshop etc, but why bother with complex software as a poin and shooter with these fun features?! ...and instant gratification with Toy Camera: shoot images with the effect of a toy camera ... i guess it sounds like a toy camera (the shutter release haha) ... Pop effect:  shoot images in pop and colorful colors ... Partial color: shoots dramatic images coloring only the extracted colors (extract red, green, blue, yellow)...like a red rose in a black and white pic ...sweet...Soft High key Effect:  shootswarm fresh photos emphasizing the bright areas.4)  It takes amazing video (i didn't buy it for video, but it does do a great job)  but hey I take it and it is a bonus to me.Video Format : MP4(AVC/H.264)Video Mode : 1280x720(Fine)(1,280x720/30fps)/1280x720(Standard)(1,280x720/30fps)/VGA(640x480/30fps)Audio Format : AACMicrophone/Speaker : Mono/monoThat sums up my reasons why I consider this a great 5 star camera and a fantastic buy for ANYONE.This is a complete one-click-wonder and may become even a serious photographers little angel in the pocket (it is for me for sure) ... because the best camera is the one you have with you ... and if it has to fit in a pocket, this definitely the best!

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-Shot DSCW650
Reviews.Author: Naiomie
Reviews.Content: I love Sony Cyber-shot Cameras. I previously owned the W55 in pink and bought this one in silver. I made a fantastic upgrade. Now you can access the entire manuel within the camera, plus the panoramic view is included. I've had no problems with this camera. I also like that when I zoom-in to take a photo it doesn't come out blurry.

Reviews.Title: awesome pictures
Reviews.Author: galaxia
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for a month and it is great! the battery life is awesome. so many features, such great photos

Reviews.Title: Sony Camera pricelss!
Reviews.Author: disgruntled
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Zeiss lenz is the best. So many ways to get best results. If you like to ajust, you'll like this camera. I take photos of my art work (pictures), large and small. Lighting is never a problem. Oh, I almost forgot to say going from one thing to another isn't quick like a bunny so some people reviewed it who were impatient. Read the reivews and you'll see what I mean. I took pictures all the way through the Vatican Museum in Rome and they were excellent.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Darlean Spangenberger
Reviews.Content: The battery lost it's charged after about 6 hours and we were unable to take additional pictures that we wanted.  The battery was fully charged so there is no reason it was dead after about 6 hours.  A lot of the pictures were very blurry and dark even thought we had it set on the automatic feature which is supposed to set the camera automatically for all the shots you take.Would not recommend and will probably have to get another camera to use.

Reviews.Title: pretty good
Reviews.Author: Bernarda Pineda "RONALD STHORMES"
Reviews.Content: nice article related to the low price... now i have great pictures and good videos from a well known brand and for a good price

Reviews.Title: A nice gift!
Reviews.Author: Melissa N. Burnett
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this camera a few years ago, so when my daughter asked for a camera for Christmas I purchased this item quickly. It works great and she loves it!

Reviews.Title: Won't charge from USB
Reviews.Author: Just me "rforster62"
Reviews.Content: A bit disappointed with my purchase. (Bought at Fry's) One charge I did from the AC charger went well but could not charge the camera from the USB while on my trip. Why Sony doesn't just include an AC to USB adapter is beyond me. Can't download the pictures to tell you how they are because the camera is dead. Will post back on that.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W650 16.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom...
Reviews.Author: Bryck Antillon Zuñiga
Reviews.Content: Impresionante rendimiento, realmente ha sido una herramienta super útil desde que la adquirí para ciertas cosas del trabajo, la calidad de fotografías en el área de macro me ha dejado más que satisfecho. Las opciones de configuraciones faciles de manipular. Realmente una excelente compra.Impressive performance, has really been a super useful tool since I bought some things to work, the quality of photographs in the macro area has left me more than satisfied. Configurations options easily manipulated. Really an excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Crystal Richardson
Reviews.Content: Amazing shots especially in low lit environments. I don't have any problems. Easy to use, very light in weight. Not bulky to carry around.

Reviews.Title: You Get Most of What You Should Expect.
Reviews.Author: BDavis
Reviews.Content: It works well. A lot better than my previous camera and the camera on my phone, although that might not be saying much if you're actually into photography. But, if you are into photography, there's really no reason you should be looking into a camera like this. Is there?Anyway, my only complaint is that I can't figure out how to get night pictures to look anything like the scene I'm trying to take of picture of. Either my eyes are seriously messed up or everything looks way brighter in the pictures than they do in real life. Maybe that's a downfall of a camera of this type, but I find it annoying. I also don't like Sony's proprietary batteries and cords, but since I haven't lost any of them yet i won't complain too much. Hoepfully I won't lose any of them, bc I'm REALLY not looking forward to buying Sony brand batteries or cords, as I assume they'll be expensive due to the exclusivity of them.Still, I give this 4 stars bc I knew about the battery and the cords before I purchased the camera.

Reviews.Title: It's ok.
Reviews.Author: Melody O "Paw parent"
Reviews.Content: It just wasn't as great as I expected. My old Sony camera with 1/2 the pixels seems to take pics just as well. I do like the larger screen, the black and white and a few other things, but I could of just stuck with my old camera and been just as happy.

Reviews.Title: wow - value for money bundle
Reviews.Author: subeesh
Reviews.Content: no other word to explain WOWWWWWWReally good camera comes with a handy bag  and  SD card. Less than 120 bucks is a really good deal for a great camera having a lot of features

Reviews.Title: Cámara fotografica Fabulosa/ Fabulous Foto Camera
Reviews.Author: Elazam
Reviews.Content: Maravillosa cámara fotográfica marca sony, colmo mis expectativas, recomiendo comprar el producto, y la garantía es fantástica / Wonderful brand sony camera, my expectations high, recommend buying the product, and the warranty is great

Reviews.Title: bad battery door
Reviews.Author: Gerald J. Lipchik "griddler"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and it works fine but the battery/memory card door latch broke off. I have to secure it closed with a small rubber band now. I had this problem with my last Sony camera too and next time I think I will look for another brand. The camera was over 6 months bought so I could not return it. beware.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: wispofisis
Reviews.Content: Camera works great. It takes awesome pictures and video. I previously have a Sony Cyber-shot and it worked great as well but was just looking for something a bit better and looked around a bit and found this camera on sony.com but then found it cheaper on amazon. I think its great for the price only thing is I wish they would have had this model in pink. :)

Reviews.Title: Good value.  Sometimes the blacks are too deep.
Reviews.Author: Meng Qi
Reviews.Content: Good camera.  Got it (slightly used) on the most popular auction website for 65 dollars.  Works out of the box.  Shoots beautiful pictures with almost no adjustment on the settings.Sometimes the blacks are too deep when the rest of the picture is bright.  For example I took a picture of my house with the garage open.  The garage and car looked meshed together in black patches.  Adjusting exposure settings or enable flash might fix the problem, but I have not tried yet.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Penny A. Friend
Reviews.Content: I purchased these for my student use in my computer classes.  The image quality and options are amazing.  The panoramic feature is a favorite!

Reviews.Title: Cheap Camera.  Battery cover pops open.  Cheap plastic catch broke off 1st day.
Reviews.Author: Luigi
Reviews.Content: Great size, good carl zeiss lens, good price, BUT little details like the battery cover lock not catching and staying shut is problem.  Cheap, plastic-y unit.  Didn't last long!

Reviews.Title: Nice pics, but...
Reviews.Author: NAS "NAS"
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice little camera, lots of features, but disability to check the last picture taken drives my crazy!

Reviews.Title: Not impressed!!!
Reviews.Author: Tilly
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd sony Cyber shot camera and I must say I am very disappointed.  I purchased this based on the other 2, which I was very impressed with.  I would not recommend this at all, pictures are blurry, and have yellow tones, when you set on the color extraction mode, even when not wearing lipstick it makes the lips of the subject stand out bright red, which spoils the picture.  I could go on and on with my disappointment, waste of money!

Reviews.Title: Looks and feels cheap, features are very basic, you get what you paid for
Reviews.Author: J. Komala "avid shopper"
Reviews.Content: I have owned many cameras from many makes and models. Currently I have two Canon DSLRs and half a dozen mirrorless compact system cameras from Sony, Samsung, Panasonic, Nikon and Pentax.In short, I know quite a bit about digital cameras, not just the technical details but also the built-quality, the aesthetic and the handling / user interface for example.I purchased this Sony W650 as a gift for my mom.Before deciding to buy it, I was torn between it and Canon Elph 100 HS. I loved the Canon P&S; cameras I owned in the past but I also loved Sony ones I had as well.Between these two, Sony W650 is newer and cheaper. It also has sweep panorama. The camera looks pretty in the pictures.However, once I have it on my hand, I can tell immediately that while the front has a nice look of brushed metal finish, the back looks like it's made of cheap plastic. If I hold the back of the camera against a light source, I can see uneven surface as if a result of a bad paint job. I got the red color one by the way.The buttons look and feel cheap as well. The zoom is not smooth / even but rather jumpy. Going through the menu, I can tell that this is not a camera I would love to use. The camera features are very basic. Eg. for the flash, you can only choose either Auto or Off (at least on the intelligent Auto mode).It is a far cry from all other point and shoot cameras I have used in the past including Sony W50/W55.I went to a local brick and mortar store to get a better comparison between many different point and shoot cameras. For a point and shoot camera, the price only makes sense as long as it is below $200. Because above that, you enter into a realm of mirrorless compact system camera which most have significatly larger sensor than typical point and shoot cameras. So I limit my price range to below $200.I went back to the other camera I was originally interested on. At the brick and mortar store, they only have the Elph 110 HS which is the newer model but for the most part identical to the 100 HS.Canon 100 HS has "only" 12 megapixels while Sony W650 has 16 megapixels.However, most point and shoot cameras such as these have tiny imaging sensor, 1/2.3" (6.17mm x 4.55mm) to be exact. Higher megapixels generally means higher noise.Canon 100 HS has a more beautiful finish throughout its surface. No bad paint job LOL.Buttons are flushed, which may irk some people, but I found that they are fine. They are larger than those on the Sony and don't look like they may come off or break off easily like the Sony's.Menus look better. It has more features than the Sony's.In the end, I returned the Sony W650 and bought the Canon Elph 100HS.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Northern star
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the price and all these seemingly great specifications, this camera is really not worth the money- it is very light and has a cheap feel to match the price- resolution on the viewfinder remainds me of my old Nokia phone from 5 years ago- takes at least 10 seconds to retrieve a photo and no instant viewing- the so-called Carl Zeiss lens is not the real thing as the brand name was licensed to Sony and lenses made elsewhere- cannot charge the camera directly as the battery needs to be taken out and charged separately each time- most importantly the picture quality is absolute crap. At 16.1mp the pictures are fuzzy and lack clarity, colors look overly saturated and they can only be used for 4x3 prints, enlarge any further you'd be better off using an iPhone insteadOverall I regret buying this and won't recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: Worked for 3 months.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Bauer "Daniel Bauer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading some positive reviews.  Got it in March, just in time for our Disney World trip with our kids.  Camera worked great and took great pictures.  A few weeks ago I tried to upload pictures to my computer from the camera.  For some reason, my computer wouldn't acknowledge that the camera was connected and I thought it was a computer problem since my computer is starting to fail on me.  I finally got my pictures to upload and now the camera tells me that my empty memory card is full.  I've tried several other cards, also empty and it tells me the same thing.  I'm irritated.  I've been unable to take pictures with this camera for almost a month.  I thought Sony would be more reputable.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE CAMERA; HORRIBLE SUPPORT
Reviews.Author: Ping Porsche
Reviews.Content: WHY CAN'T I GIVE NEGATIVE STARS?DON'T BUY THIS OR ANY OTHER SONY CAMERA!!!!!Sony makes crap cameras and their support will accuse you of breaking it.Purchase from a respectable camera maker like Canon, Nikon, or Fuji.I bought this for snorkeling and it corrupted my memory card on the first trip.OK, $10,000 trip with no pictures, because the camera corrupted the memory.Called Sony and they blamed the memory.Got two new memory cards for the next trip.OK, new trip, $5k trip with no pictures because the entire stupid camera craps out.Called Sony, no apologies, no emergency loaner, just a send it in with the receipt so we can verify it's still under warranty.Sent the camera in to the depot, on my own dime.They call and accused me of opening the camera door.What idiots! Why the hell would I do that? So I can ruin my pictures?  TWICE????!!!!!I contacted all the way up to national customer support.All idiots along the way.They didn't do a user test underwater.They just dunk it and say it's still WATER-RESISTANT, so it must be user error.F#$% OFF SONY!!!!Whatever you do, buy something else and save your money, this is a horrible product, that takes horrible pictures and is slow as mud, with a horrible touchscreen that doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: Where's the Macro focus?
Reviews.Author: Randy L. Haynam
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace my Sony DSC-W90 and was disappointed. The DSC-W650 does not have a Macro focus setting for ultra close ups that I often use to photograph items for eBay. The package that it came in did not reflect this. It had a panaramic feature which I would rarely use.  In addition, the battery was different than my older Cybershot which means all my old spare batteries would be worthless. The memory card is also a different size which would have made all my spare Memory Stick PRO Duo cards worthless. Which also means my Sony magic Gate PRO reader would be rendered worthless.  The DSC-W650 was a a little more flimsy and harder to access the memory card and battery.  Had to take it back for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Garbage !
Reviews.Author: Teresa
Reviews.Content: A really bad Camera...Doesn't look anything like the picture. The photos are a really bad quality and they come out yellow.

Reviews.Title: Nice

Reviews.Title: Battery cover won't close - Mediocre picture quality
Reviews.Author: climberkent
Reviews.Content: I lost my previous Cybershot and bought this one.  The battery/sim card cover doesn't lock in place.  It has a super flimsy andcheap mechanical slide that doesn't hold the door closed.  It pops open all the time and now it won't even close.I wasn't pleased with the design either.  The camera tries to be idiot proof, and as a result takes all the decisions away from thephotographer.  Focus is fair to poor.  I bought a Canon equivalent for my son and now his camera is better than mine.  His takesmuch sharper pictures than my Cybershot, and his cost less money.  I'm all done with Sony cameras.  They had a good thing going for awhile, but they've cheaped them down way too much.  I'm out.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as it should be...Screen is blurry
Reviews.Author: SpeedingCheetah
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift. I was previously using a Kodak EasyShare C143. The Kodak took sharper pictures and had more fine detail almost every shot. The C143 is a 12MP camera that takes pics at 4000 x 3000 at 480dpi.  This Sony camera DSC-W650, is 16.1MP and takes pics at 4608 x 3456 at 350dpi.I also compared it to my older 8MP Kodak ZD8612 IS....(3264 X 2448 at 480dpi) and those pics are still a bit sharper and clearer than this new Sony camera.The C143's auto focus was faster and noticeably more accurate than the Sony's...almost all of my pics are clear and detailed..on the Sony, lucky to have half of them turn out.I mostly take pics indoors, and the Sony's flash isn't that great. Low light performance is poor. Pictures loose significant detail at higher iso's.The HD video recording on this camera is great, definitely much better than the 2 other cams, but they aren't HD..so no real contest there.One thing I really like about this camera though, is it has a "Easy Mode"...where is makes the text big and camera VERY simple to use...dumbed down menus, locks out everything except pure basic functions... for those people like my folks can use...just point and press button. My 70yr old Grandma would really like that...Assuming she could remember how to turn the camera on...lol.I also noticed the LCD screen display is quite fuzzy and distorted, no where near as sharp as my old Kodak...even the text on the screen is phased out and blurry...hard to read..the screen seems to flicker or...just look out of sync...or something...hard on the eyes...and if you look at the screen from any other angle other than straight at it....eye level..it is super blurry, very bad viewing angles.I contacted Sony support...spent over an hour on the phone going through their stupid "idiots" method of troubleshooting, resting camera, pulling battery in and out, etc...I HATE THAT!!!... finally, the guy in India told me they will accept the cam in for repair this one time...even though I could not produce a receipt. Annoying to have to pay to ship defective things back to companies...they should cover shipping both ways, since it was their fault their quality control missed it....but...yea...what company ever does that nowadays..will update once i get cam back in..o..whenever they decide to...UPDATE: Just picked up this: Panasonic LUMIX DMC-ZS19 Digital Camera- Black  Like it much better. See my review their.UPDATE 12/27/12: Sent in cam for repair. Had to pay to ship it to them. Got call from Sony a week alter "technician found nothing wrong". I re-explained the issue with the lcd screen...the guy (who could barely speak English) took about 10 min of explaining to realize a hardware issue..then he quickly told me "I update and we work on it"...2 hrs later I get an automated email from Sony stating the camera is being shipped back to me.Received it today...and can't tell any difference. The included paperwork has marks on it indicating the lcd panel was replaced and the camera cleaned and lubricated, but the screen still looks horrible fuzzy and the menus still have a a flicker effect to them. The screen has poor viewing angles. No where near as sharp and clear as the Panasonic ZS19 camera I bought to replace this one. Despite the poor quality lcd, this Sony seems to take decent pictures, they look fine on the computer. Just annoying, as you may not be sure the picture you take is in focus or blurry or not, as the pictures always look blurry on the built in screen.

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: sswy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in August, 2012 and -- maybe I don't know what to expect from a low-end camera -- but it's very disappointing.  It's so bad I almost wonder if mine is defective.  I shot a bunch of pictures on a trip in "Program Auto" mode (differs from "Intelligent Auto" mainly in that you can set the ISO).  Where to start?Calling it 16.1 megapixels is a joke.  At full resolution, the images are so grainy and posterized that they are unusable for any purpose.  You can get OK images for sharing on the web by resampling them down to about 300,000 pixels (i.e. reduce 98%) and then sharpen in Photoshop.  But it would be easier to just buy a 1-megapixel camera and avoid the extra work.  The camera has low-resolution settings, and I will try those in the future.  Perhaps part of the problem is excessive or sloppy jpeg compression, but the camera seems to have no setting that would allow you to capture raw images even if you wanted to.The camera says it has 5x optical zoom, but fully zoomed, the pictures looked like taken through a fog that wasn't there.The camera has ISO settings up to 3200, but at 800 the quality is already so bad you might as well not bother (unless it's something urgent to photograph and you don't care about quality.)  At 400 the images are already notably degraded.The exposure metering is inconsistent.  If you start pointing at the sky, and then move down to your subject, you will get a very different image from when you start pointing at something dark and move to the subject.  The auto-focus (the only focus you get on this type of camera) is not very reliable, and quite a few images are poorly focused.  The auto-focus gets especially confused by shiny, metal objects like bronze statues.Contrast control is terrible.  Nearly every image has white burned in patches.  Sky on a cloudy day nearly always goes pure white.  I have used half a dozen digital cameras (OK, all more expensive), and this one is hands down the worst for chronic overburn.In program auto mode, the camera has a strange bias toward fast shutter and low depth of field (such as 1/320 at 3.5), so lots of images have needlessly blurred patches in the foreground or background (and you can't control that.)Perhaps I am being unreasonable, and a $100 camera is the digital equivalent of the paper box throw-away film camera, and it's not fair to expect anything in the way of image quality.  But sheesh.  The camera is so disappointing that I am tempted to put Sony down with HP on my don't buy anything ever list.  I hate to be mean but I would have saved $139 if someone had written this review six months ago.
